canonical.name: Kou
canonical.title: 18. Kou / Toward Corruption
canonical.judgment: Kou indicates great progress and success to them who deals properly with the condition represented by it. There will be advantage in efforts like that of crossing the great stream. One should weigh well, however, the events of three days before the turning point, and those to be done three days after it.
canonical.image: The trigram for a mountain, and below it that for wind, form Kou. The superior person, in accordance with this, nourishes their own virtue and helps the people.

1.text: shows a child dealing with the troubles caused by their father. If they be an able child, the father will escape the blame of having erred. The position is perilous, but there will be good fortune in the end.

2.text: shows a child dealing with the troubles caused by their mother. They should not carry their firm correctness to the utmost.

3.text: shows a child dealing with the troubles caused by their father. There may be some small occasion for repentance, but there will not be any great error.

4.text: shows a child viewing indulgently the troubles caused by their father. If they go forward, they will find cause to regret it.

5.text: shows a child dealing with the troubles caused by their father. They obtain the praise of using the fit instrument for their work.

6.text: shows us one who does not serve either king or feudal lord, whose lofty spirit prefers to attend to their own affairs.

metadata.notes: Original translation preserved from pyChing v1.2.2
